alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 3:31PM MDT until June 14 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Wind River Basin...including Dubois, Crowheart, Kinnear, Riverton...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring, and will gradually fall this evening. * WHERE...Wind River near Kinnear. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor agricultural flooding along right bank. Water begins to move towards low areas north of Highway 132. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Agricultural flooding along both banks becomes more widespread and intensifies. Water begins to encroach the north end of Highway 132. At 9.9 feet, Record stage and flow---16,600 cfs (7/1/2011). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to minor flood stage with a maximum value of 9.0 feet this evening into the overnight. A gradual decrease is forecast later tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM MDT.
